sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"接受，接纳"之意。
means: accept ：强调主动地或自愿地接受，或者说，经过考虑后同意接受。
receive ：着重仅仅接到或收到这一支轮船或事实，而不含采取主动或积极行动的意思。
admit ：作"接受"讲时，强调准许或批准。
take ：与receive同意，是receive的日常用法，侧重不带主观意愿地收下或接受。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含"承认"之意。
means: acknowledge ：通常指公开承认某事的真实情况或自己的过错。
admit ：强调因外力或良心驱使或经判断而明确承认，多含不情愿或被迫意味。
confess ：语气较强，着重承认自己意识到的错误或罪行，含坦白忏悔的意味。
recognize ：作"承认"解时，系书面用词，主要指合法的或外交上的承认，也指公认。
concede ：指在事实与证据面前勉强或不得不承认。

sentence.Network_en: You have to admit that you are, in fact, in difficulties.
sentence.Network_cn: 你不得不承认，你事实上是陷入了困境。

sentence.Network_en: Embassy security personnel refused to admit him or his wife.
sentence.Network_cn: 使馆保安人员不允许他和夫人进入。

sentence.Network_en: I have to admit that I have bad handwriting.
sentence.Network_cn: 我不得不承认自己的字写得不好看。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English : from Latin admittere, from ad- 'to' + mittere 'send'

entry.def: If you admit that something bad, unpleasant, or embarrassing is true, you agree, often unwillingly, that it is true.

example.ex: I am willing to admit that I do make mistakes...
example.tran: 我愿意承认我确实会犯错。

example.ex: Up to two thirds of 14 to 16 year olds admit to buying drink illegally...
example.tran: 14到16岁的青少年中多达2/3的人承认非法买过酒。

entry.def: If someone is admitted to hospital, they are taken into hospital for treatment and kept there until they are well enough to go home.

example.ex: She was admitted to hospital with a soaring temperature...
example.tran: 她因发高烧被送进医院。

example.ex: He was admitted yesterday for treatment of blood clots in his lungs.
example.tran: 他昨天入院治疗肺部的血块。

entry.def: If someone is admitted to an organization or group, they are allowed to join it.

example.ex: He was admitted to the Academie Culinaire de France...
example.tran: 他获准加入法兰西厨艺学会。

example.ex: The Parachute Regiment could be forced to admit women.
example.tran: 伞兵团可能会被迫招收女性。

entry.def: To admit someone to a place means to allow them to enter it.

example.ex: Embassy security personnel refused to admit him or his wife...
example.tran: 使馆保安人员不允许他和夫人进入。

example.ex: Journalists are rarely admitted to the region.
example.tran: 新闻记者很少获准进入该地区。

means.word_mean: 1. declare to be true or admit the existence or reality or truth of;

sentences.sentence: "She acknowledged that she might have forgotten"

means.word_mean: 2. allow to enter; grant entry to;

sentences.sentence: "We cannot admit non-members into our club"

means.word_mean: 3. allow participation in or the right to be part of; permit to exercise the rights, functions, and responsibilities of;

sentences.sentence: "She was admitted to the New Jersey Bar"

means.word_mean: 4. admit into a group or community;

sentences.sentence: "We'll have to vote on whether or not to admit a new member"
"This short story allows of several different interpretations"
"The French doors admit onto the yard"

means.word_mean: 7. have room for; hold without crowding;

sentences.sentence: "The auditorium can't hold more than 500 people"

means.word_mean: 8. serve as a means of entrance;

sentences.sentence: "This ticket will admit one adult to the show"

stems_affixes.word_buile: intermit[v.中断]+t+ent……的→adj.间歇的,断断续续的
per始终+mit送,放出,派,错过→始终放出→许可

stems_affixes.value_cn: 承认,供认;准许……进入,准许……加入
把……交托给,委托,委任;提交;犯[错误],干[坏事]
stems_affixes.word_buile: com共同+mit送,放出,派,错过→共同送→委托

stems_affixes.value_cn: 发出;放射;吐露;散发;发表;发行
stems_affixes.word_buile: e出+mit送,放出,派,错过→送出[气味]等
inter在……中间+mit送,放出,派,错过→在中间送东西→打断,间断
sub在下面+mit送,放出,派,错过→放下面→屈服
per始终+mit送,放出,派,错过→始终放出→许可
re再次+mit送,放出,派,错过→再次放出,送[钱]→宽恕,汇款

Sentence.sentence: I think the senator rightly communicated that we had not been clear about what the new products were and how people could choose to use them or not to use them," Schrage admits.
the number of their students admitted to college
Although most people admitted to some lingering rivalry, it was rarely strong enough to end the relationship.
About one eighth of them admitted to lingering bitter feelings
They do not admit being alcohol addicts.

sentences.en: He was admitted into their fullest confidence.
sentences.cn: 他获得了他们的充分信任。

sentences.en: The gate admits to the yard.

means.word_mean: 容许，容许有，容得；留有余地，给予机会(of)

sentences.en: The regulations admit of no exception.

jushi.english: The harbour admits large tankers and freighters.
jushi.chinese: 这个港口容得下巨型油船和货轮。

jushi.english: He admitted his mistake with a good grace.
I admit the truth of your statement.
jushi.chinese: 我承认你的说法是正确的。
